storyInfo: Gertrude is taken away by the spy, but Kreide's health has deteriorated further. After studying the files obtained from the laboratory, this group of souls draws up a desperate plan.

attributes.content: Down!
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: In your dreams!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Fancy that, you can still struggle...
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'm not holding this one back, Dame Strollo!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You‚Äîread me?!
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Who knew you could bite off more than you could chew?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Unripe. You're just relying on the Voice of Mundane... Your control of Arts is still in its infancy‚Äî
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Hrragh!!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Huff, *pant*, *pant*...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: D‚ÄîDid that get her...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Heh, I never thought you'd be one to best me, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: So you admit defeat?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hmph. A loss is a loss. What, does not admitting it make it my victory instead?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You... Why are you unperturbed?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Because... how exactly can you lay a finger on me?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'm the Lehnsfrau of this city. It's night, you broke into a concert hall I administrate, and you attempted to tear down legitimate renovations ratified by my own person.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You even injured me as I did my best to stop you‚Äî
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Graf Urtica, Rhodes Islander, and you, Czerny. You should be the worried ones, isn't that right?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: As despicable as ever, Gertrude.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Despicable? Is that how you treat your patron, your back of over a decade?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Czerny, I allowed you to use this concert hall.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: You're no more than a mere Infected. Your position? I gave you that too.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Your cherished Afterglow could only limp its way to the present day on MY benevolence.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Don't forget that.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: How dare‚Äî!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: All of you, kindly leave.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I wouldn't be so sure.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Graf Urtica‚Äîthis title carries with it disgrace, all throughout Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But it also means that wherever I go, the Empresses' informants are sure to be.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And what if they are? I told you, you're only making vain attempts to destroy my music hall.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Even if Their Majesties' agents were to show themselves, they would arrest you by all rights, not me.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Biegler! Biegler!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You have to have witnessed this all now, right?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you still intend to fold your arms and watch?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I saw the grand Graf Urtica fall to breaking and entering a concert hall, in the dead of night, with a gang. Aside from that, I saw nothing.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Did you not hear her plot?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you mean Gr√§fin Strollo's plot, or the Graf Urtica's plot jointly schemed with her?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Why you...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I did in fact hear.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: However, even if I recorded your entire dialogue just now, that doesn't prove a thing.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Evidence, Graf. Everything needs carefully selected evidence. What proves Gr√§fin Strollo intended to act against the Empresses?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Proof. You come to me at this moment and raise the matter of proof...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Right. The Voice of Mundane!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: We discovered there was research into the Voice of Mundane in the sewers!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Seems you're not off the ball after all, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: What research? I know nothing about this.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Feigning stupidity at this point's pass√©, Gr√§fin Strollo.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You may not be directly linked to the notes and plans in that sewer laboratory, but we have our ways.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: With our leads there, it'll be a walk in the park to find your other little bases.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You are presently suspected of launching research into the Voice of Mundane forbidden under Their Majesties' decree. I want you to come with me.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Wait, because she was researching the Voice and nothing else?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let me reiterate to you again, Graf Urtica, and the rest of you.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: As long as you have no clear evidence, proof your 'foul product' is going to blow up like you say it does‚Äî
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Every accusation you throw at her turns into slander, nothing else.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Let me take a look at those Voice of Mundane research files! I can give you exhaustive evidence!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Very sorry, but that's classified Leithanian information. I can't hand it over to a foreign organization.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You're just wishing it out of existence!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: There's a lot in these lands that doesn't go the way you want it, Fr√§ulein.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: But...!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Let it go, Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He's made his point very clear. Our discoveries aren't enough to convict Gr√§fin Strollo.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And he only showed himself because he found other evidence to do so.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I should even be thanking you for deigning to show up in the wake of my hissy fit. Isn't that right, Biegler, my dear spy?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'll be honest, if I had to compare you and Gr√§fin Strollo as nobles, I'd say you win out in my books, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: And you, Herr Czerny.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: We have Gr√§fin Strollo contained now. Even if whatever your friends are worried about is real, either way, the concert's safe.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Of course, I still recommend you cancel it. Safest for settling this.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I thought the concert tomorrow had already been forbidden.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Whether you hold it remains up to you.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Okay, Gr√§fin Strollo, I believe your loyalty to the Empresses. I'd just like to take you for... breakfast. You wouldn't refuse my invitation, would you?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Hah. Breakfast in these early hours? Very well.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Graf Urtica, you will regret betraying me.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: I'll regret many a thing, but that is the one matter I never will.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Well, we've just let them go.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Gertrude...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You still had a word waiting for her?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If profanity counts for a word.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Kreide still hasn't woken.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Leave him with me, I'll set off straight away and bring him to the Rhodes Island landship.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You're taking him away?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I am. He'll only get the proper treatment at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I won't allow it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Even if you can pacify his condition, what will you do about the Voice of Mundane?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't doubt your medical prowess, but is that something you can truly solve?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I can't promise.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But we've got no other choice now.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Don't tell me you still hope Gertrude'll help you get rid of it through ensemble?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I can only hope.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You're‚Äî
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: How long will it take from Vyseheim to your landship, I ask you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You won't say. Because you know Kreide isn't likely to make it there.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But even if what Gertrude says is true, are you really going to sacrifice yourself to do this?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: As long as I can do it, why shouldn't I?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hibiscus stares, blank, for a spell.
The look in his eyes now, compared to when she first met this young man‚Äîthe difference is like black and white.
He's serious, she thinks.
Fine.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Even if I help you to the best of my ability, we know too little about the Voice of Mundane, and what we do know was all told to us by the Countess. We're sifting through fact and fiction...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Looks like I made it.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Sir, you...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: If you need more info about the Voice of Mundane, I have this project plan right here.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Sir, did you...?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You pulled the same thing as Biegler...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I did.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: You probably imagined, but Kreide's a fin who slipped through the program's net back in the day.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: How could the Empresses let such a wildcard wander freely, you know?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But you've been roaming together for more than a decade!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: And that's why no one ever suspected it.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But didn't Biegler say it was classified‚Äî
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Which is why I filched it from where he kept it.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: If I can save Kreide, then the hell does it matter if anyone's shown this damned plan?! And it's a long-overdue damning if you ask me!
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*, *cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: C‚ÄîCalm down, you're still very weak...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Let me see the plan papers, Hibiscus. You take this old fellow somewhere to rest.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Sir... does Kreide‚Äîdoes he know?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I never told him, but he's very smart. I'm sure he has a vague guess.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: This is too cruel to him.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Cruel.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Fr√§ulein, do you know how I became an Infected?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Surely you've heard how in the age before the Empresses' rule, Leithanien had explored classical Originium Arts to heights hardly surpassable.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: So do you know the price Leithanien paid, to reach those heights?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Countless human sacrifices, among which were huge numbers of Infected.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Yes. Infected.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: During that period, some Kurf√ºrsten were even handing over Infected to a regular quota, and they treated this as a custom.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But Infected are people too. It's not like they'd let their lives be thrown away.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: So, can you guess what happened in the end?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: You don't mean...?!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: It looks like you have.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Just slash your arm with Originium, and now you qualify as an Infected too.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: That's how mine came about.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Melody... it's melody. The Voices of the Mundane are the melodies the Witch King left behind!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I can't believe this...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: No, this is the only way it makes sense!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: He wasn't just Leithanien's mightiest Caster. The Witch King was also Leithanien's most feared musician.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: His mastery of music was at the epitome. Some even said his insight into music was of the same grade as his Originium Arts research.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But rhythm, tonality, texture... he threw those raw elements that make up the beauty of music to the hounds. Every piece of his left in this world is filled with murder and devastation.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: His opuses have long been forbidden pieces in Leithanien. If the Voice of Mundane is a string of melodies left by the Witch King‚Äî
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then the Voice is without a doubt a remnant opus of his, and you are its very extents.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: We are not his opus!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You shouldn't deceive yourself. Moreover, if this is the case...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You have a solution?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I need you to perform the ensemble that repelled those Originium slugs again.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: When you did that, you grasped the Voices inside yourselves, didn't you?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Ensemble? Right now?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you comprehend the situation we're in here?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I do, and I know it better than you do!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But‚Äî!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let's hear Herr Czerny out, Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Kreide, are you alright? Did you come here alone?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Andante brought me over.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: But you can't double the Voice of Mundane's melody again like you did before. It did something wrong to you last time...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't want to leave any regrets.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Alright... Herr Czerny, what did you think of?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: If the Voice can be said to be a string of melodies, then whether those remnants who used you for their experiment, or Gertrude...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Their aim has to be to conduct the Originium Arts contained within that melody, or should I say, the melody that flows within this Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Which is to say, their exploration of the Voice is entirely to unearth the supposed secrets within.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: In plain words, they're trying to make the Voice more 'clear,' more 'beautiful.'
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Thus, there is one thing I can very definitively tell you‚Äî
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: There is no method that can 'transfer' the Voice anywhere in these plans.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I'm not surprised anymore.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But that's not because doing so would be too difficult. Precisely the opposite. It's because, in their eyes, it would be a waste of what they have.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Because every melody the Witch King left behind is different. Each comes from its own period, and contains its own completely separate emotions and ideas.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: What sense can there be in putting two entirely different songs together?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Just as when you performed together, the further you pursue it, the more disastrous the effects become.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Even the Originium slugs fled because they felt your performance to be far too ear-bleeding.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I presume they've done similar transfer experiments before, and realized how bad the results were... then.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: They did.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: However, even if two pieces are diametrically opposed, a sufficient lead-in can still be enough to accomplish the transition.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Therefore, I want you to perform my Morgen und Abend.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Upon which, I want you to dig your own selves out from within the piece, just as you did that evening.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I have to feel the melody the Voice of Mundane left within you, and then, I will write you a new song.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Wait. No matter what, you need something to hold the Voice so you can transfer it.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: And the experiment results said all attempts to implant two Voices in one person failed.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I'll be the vessel, is that what you mean?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't trust that little determination you have to be enough for self-sacrifice, boy.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I will try with all my might, through performance, to drag the Voices from the both of you.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If I cannot, I will personally serve as this receptacle, if I am able to.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Why would you go so far for us?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If I remember correctly, my Morgen und Abend was your turning point in learning flute.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: And so what?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So it's likely you heard of how I came to write it. That Gertrude woman had to turn it into a blasted 'selling point' for me, though I never wanted for anyone else to know.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You lost your dearest, closest friend, and you wrote the piece in your grief.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: 'Grief.'
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That description was far off the mark.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You should be using the term 'indignation.'
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That was the first time I came to find that life would not unfold how I imagined it, and the first time I knew what music meant to me‚Äî
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: My rebellion against a fixed fate.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Turning ordinary civilians into Infected... That's too cruel...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I have no idea how many times I cursed the Witch King in those days, but perhaps someone heard my tirades.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: However, before they could send me to the laboratories, Their Majesties had overthrown the Witch King. I was saved.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: And that's why I swore to dedicate the rest of my life to Their Majesties' cause.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: And so you became a spy?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I can't tell you what I did when I was an agent, and you don't need to know.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: All you need to know is that I was the agent who found the Witch King's Remains that had been researching the Voice of Mundane.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: By the time we found them, they had already experimented on Kreide and failed. It's why his body is the way it is now.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: You didn't plan to save him, right?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: How'd you know?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: From what I know, when the Twin Empresses ascended to the throne, they issued an edict that forbade all Witch King era research, and the Voice of Mundane research obviously fell into that category.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But if the Voice of Mundane is really that amazing, I can't imagine that not a single person has turned his attention to it in the twenty years since the Witch King was overthrown.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: What's more... 'The Witch King left his mark within.' 'The Witch King weaved his power into the melody.' The Witch King himself is the core of these ideas.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Deep down, their pursuit of the Voice of Mundane might actually be nothing more than worshipping the Witch King himself.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: And given the way that Mr. Biegler does things, I'd say a spy's principles lie with serving the Twin Empresses.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: In other words, to spies like you, the Voice of Mundane doesn't further the Twin Empresses' interests in any way.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Junge Frau, until I saw how reckless you were, I took you for a fool.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: And now, it seems you just didn't know how to put your wits to use.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Uhh.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You're goddamned right. Here, I brought the research plan along. There's no point in hiding any of this anymore.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: The Voice of Mundane is unique. It's undoubtedly the Witch King's lingering echoes in the world, and there is definitely some power hidden within.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But the Witch King's fervent followers truly believed that the Witch King left behind his avatar within it.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: The power the Voice of Mundane holds is too unique. It will never see widespread use.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: At the very least, the current court casters see research on the Voice of Mundane as a futile and pointless pursuit.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: And that's why the handling of Ebenholz and Kreide became a problem.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Was Ebenholz chosen because he was considered safer?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Yes, we had to announce the plan's failure, and Ebenholz was naturally the best choice as there was nothing wrong with his body.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: On the contrary, as there were already problems with Kreide's body... he had no choice... Death awaited him.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But he finally got away from the Witch King's Remains! And yet he had to die... That's too cruel!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Perhaps, in your eyes, our methods are inhumane.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But once you've witnessed countless tragedies, especially ones caused by those who are not inhumane, you'll come to realize that‚Äî
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: You can't let your feelings get in the way of everything.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: You probably think Biegler is a pretty heartless man, don't you.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Yeah, I do think so.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But what you don't know is he's lived in the Afterglow and spent time with its residents day after day for more than a dozen years. His feelings for this place is no less genuine than anyone else.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: There's no one who wants to skin Gertrude alive more than him, but he can't.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Do you think you're the angriest person to ever talk to him?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Mr. Biegler... he...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Besides, Kreide's condition endangers those around him, too. He has no way to get too close to anyone, and his past destined him to never live the life of a normal man.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: He truly didn't have a choice.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But you let your feelings get in the way with him. You offered him a choice other than death.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Is that really a choice? He had to wander the world with an old man who's half dead. He learned how to play the cello, and yet he rarely had a chance to even touch one.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: He can't make friends. He can't even get too close with anyone. Can you really call that a proper life?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But he lived.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Having seen how he trembled back then, I can still feel a sharp pain in my arms, even now.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: The Witch King... The Witch King.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I, Kreide, those who got infected inadvertently, and those who were forcefully infected...
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: The wounds that the Witch King left on Leithanien have yet to heal, but now there are those who thirst for his return, and there are even nobles who are sheltering his remnants and facilitating their research.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Oh, how I dread...
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I dread I won't live to see the day they all meet justice.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: *Cough*, *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: You will live.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No need to comfort me, Junge Frau.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I've lived with him for all these years. It's a miracle that I'm still alive today.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: He is like a real grandson to me.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I brought him here because I was actually thinking of introducing him to Biegler and setting him up with a job as an agent.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: That way, I would at least get to die knowing he's in good hands.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But now... It doesn't really to me so much anymore.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I always thought... it was my fate to give my life to Their Majesties as an agent, but it seems... that's not really all there is, heh...
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Sir...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Crash.
A tremendous noise comes from inside.
Go, let this old grandpa sit here a little longer. Go help them.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: If you don't feel well, be sure to call my name!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: The Voice of Mundane did not have a name, at first.
The melody was abandoned by the Witch King, after all.
It was a melody improvised by him on the spur of the moment and transcribed by his court musicians.
If the Witch King's complete pieces are howls from a deep abyss, then these fragments are indeed still melodies of the mortal realm.
And thus, these fragments were named the Voice of Mundane.
Be that as it may, the Witch King's power is still immensely terrifying.
Ebenholz, I may have asked you to show your purist form in music, but now‚Äî
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I want you to think back to your life the past two dozen-or-so years. Let your resentfulness pour out.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Music is a portraiture of your life. It's the steps you take, the eyes you peer into the world with!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Don't let your emotions cloud you, but don't betray your emotions either! Explore, vent, and drag your melody out from the deepest parts of your soul!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I... I found it...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Right, that's it! That's exactly what I want!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That's the melody that was carved into your brain... It's the melody of destruction, and it is a ravaging one.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: And you, Kreide, I need the opposite from you. I need you to constrain yourself.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You are too unreserved. You encompass everything that you've experienced. Do you know that your kindness is your greatest weakness?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Are you reconciling? Why are you reconciling? Why should you reconcile? Who has the right to ask you to reconcile?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Everyone thinks you deserve better. The idea has crossed your mind too, hasn't it?!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You still aren't willing to change the way you think, huh?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Fine. Fine.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: This is enough.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I can feel your melody too‚Äî
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: A void. A void that swallows everything whole.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Hngh...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Urgh...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Bear with it!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: The energies of two wildly different Originium Arts begin to entangle with one another inside the room as anguished expressions start to appear on the two young men's faces.
Czerny knows it is time for him to join in.
Keep playing. Do not fret. If you feel something's wrong with your body, stop immediately.
attributes.name: Czerny
Czerny
attributes.content: But If you do feel something's off, and you're not the one to blame‚Äî‚Äî

attributes.name: Czerny
attributes.content: Then leave it to me.
Czerny sits in front of the piano, takes a deep breath, and starts playing as well.
However, when he attempts to sort out the two totally different surges of energy, he realizes just how much he overestimated his abilities.
The melody is strong, full of anger, terrifying, solemn, bloody‚Äî
Above all, it's a melody that fully immerses its listeners.
One moment, he's suddenly filled with hatred toward the Witch King. The next second, he has a heartfelt admiration for him.
One moment, he feels as though he is a newborn child, but he immediately feels the passage of time and its effects on his body. The very next second, he is as old as the hills.

He forces himself to keep his appearance intact with what little sanity he has left, but he feels as though he is walking in a boundless desert. The sandstorm is too powerful, and he cannot open his eyes.
He tries his best to shake the sand off. Then, he sees a towering wall that reaches even the sky. There is nothing on the wall. No pain, no anger, and no death.
It's a simple, unadorned wall.
At that very moment, he finally realizes. That is a wall he will never be able to overcome.
His mind is instantly filled with fear.
Gah!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Czerny coughs violently, sending blood gushing out of his mouth.
His cough is so intense that he tries to get up for a drink of water, only for him to stagger and knock down the music stand next to him.
Hey, are you alright?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Herr Czerny!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I heard something just now! What happened?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: A trifle, nothing more.
attributes.name: Czerny
Czerny
attributes.content: Now I see it. It's not that no one has ever attempted to do what I did. It's just that people who tried are all dead.

attributes.name: Czerny
attributes.content: Ha, haha...
attributes.joined: But If you do feel something's off, and you're not the one to blame‚Äî‚ÄîThen leave it to me.Now I see it. It's not that no one has ever attempted to do what I did. It's just that people who tried are all dead.Ha, haha...

attributes.content: Hahahahahaha!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You're laughing?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny, You're bleeding out of your mouth... Let me wipe that for you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: How did you two feel just now?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: When we drew out the Voice of Mundane, it felt very much like I was getting torn apart.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But after you joined in, it did feel like a lot of the pressure faded.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: At the very least, this proves that my idea is workable.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But you're already...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I coughed up some blood, that's all. I know my own body better than anyone.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Let's continue.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.text: Czerny sits back on his bench.
He closes his eyes and begins to ponder a question.
Who is Czerny?
He answers himself: Czerny is a coward.
He once hid underneath the wings of his dear friend and teacher, thinking that he could live his whole life through music.
Yet the death of his dear friend, the torments of Oripathy, and poverty all worked together to make him realize that he is but an ordinary man.

attributes.content: You will die.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I've lived this long because Gertrude still thinks I have value, and so she paid for my medication and kept me alive for a few years longer than most other Infected.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But if I can't finish this piece today, I might as well be dead.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If you don't want me to die a meaningless death, pick up your flute.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.text: He answers: Czerny is a man who sees music as everything.

Before he was famous, the people of the Afterglow showed nothing but grief and sorrow whenever he went outside. They had no appreciation for the beauty of music because they didn't know whether they would live to see the next day.
To make ends meet, he had no choice but to accept Gertrude's suggestion and become a spectacle for the nobles in the music halls left behind by the Witch King, like some kind of rare animal.
Life was way too complicated, and he wanted to go back inside his house.
At all those times, it was always music that kept him from running.
He has more than music, but it is with music that he expresses everything about him.

attributes.content: Kreide, your performance is too weak.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Don't worry about me. You don't have that right!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: This is about your survival, not mine. Do not ever think it is a virtue to sacrifice yourself!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Your sacrifice is also a burden!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Scream, vent, and fight for the reward that should've been yours!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I... understand.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.text: Finally, he answers: Czerny is a man who resists fate.
Is music how he resists his fate, then?
No! Music is his struggle, his howl, and his song.
He is struggling for his friend who passed away before fulfilling her musical ideals.
He is howling for those who cannot speak.
He is singing for those who was born into suffering yet still have joy within their hearts.
In that case, is he performing in someone else's stead?
No! He knows how his friend was unwilling to die, he walked the streets where those who cannot speak gather, and he brought music to those who are trying to seek joy despite their sufferings.
Once again, he stands in front of that high wall‚Äîthe Witch King. He knows he can never overcome this wall.

But, this time, he instead reminisces about the joy of discussing music with his dear friend, he remembers the love and respect he receives from the Afterglow's residents, and he remembers the morning sun he sees at the beginning of each day.
And that is why he says‚Äî

attributes.content: Right now, I am my own opponent.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: *cough*, ourgh.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny, you're coughing up blood again!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: (He's not listening to me at all...)
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Let's go get some rest, Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: But‚Äì‚Äì
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: We don't need to be here anymore.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: What we need to do is rest up and wait for Herr Czerny to finish his new piece.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Hibiscus, take care of him.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: At the very least, I won't let him collapse before me. Now go.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Czerny's enemy is not the Witch King.
Even though the Witch King's offenses were heinously profuse, even though he disdains that monarch, he is still forced to concede that music itself stands unrelated to good or evil.
His opponent is himself, at this very moment.
He no longer tries to scale the wall so despairingly high.
He begins to perform.
Beneath his feet appears a platform. It brings him up in unbroken ascent, up through the clouds.
Though still no end to the wall can be seen, he no longer cares.
Even though he can feel the turbulent power dash about his body, and he cannot hold back further coughs of blood.
Hibiscus, to one side, is even given the illusion‚Äî
She can almost see Czerny's life flying by in accelerando, but at the same time, the score he writes rages:
Take it, take it all! Take everything of him!
Today marks the day of Czerny's death!
But Czerny's music will never die!

attributes.text: And day breaks.

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*, *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: It's... com... plete...
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That's such a relief! You're‚Äî
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: The musician strains to lift himself, but his upper body crashes against the piano, and he leaves a discordant coda in the shining dawn.
